newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhs to sell Altynalmas state gold mining firm.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhs to sell Altynalmas state gold mining firm.

text.p: Kazakhstan will hold a tender on February 21 for the sale of a 90 percent stake in the state gold and diamond mining company Altynalmas, a company official said on Monday.
Commenting on news released by the State Property Committee at the weekend, the official, who declined to be identified, said the stake had been valued at 77 million tenge.
Under the terms of the tender, the winner must also invest $82 million in the enterprise.
The official said that practically all mines belonging to the company had already been sold to separate investors and property in the tender was mostly buildings and machinery.
Altynalmas had operated various mines in the Central Asian state, including Vasilkovoskoye and Jubilenoye.
The Kazakh government last month rejected a proposal by Teck Corp and First Dynasty Mines Ltd to develop the Vasilkovskoye deposit.
Bids will be accepted until February 18.
